Welcome to Instagator!
Let's plan an adventure
Get Started

Tools for Group Planning

Planning group travel doesn't have to be a pain. Here's how we can help.

Guest Management

With group travel, it's easy to forget who's dropped out or added in. Instagator helps you keep track of group participants and helps you make sure that everyone's on the same page.

Group Activity Input

You shouldn't have to guess how the group feels about activities. Instagator makes it easy for you to get group input on activities to figure out which ones will be the biggest hits.

Document and Payment Tracking

Travel can be expensive and complicated, and it doesn't help that people are forgetful! Instagator helps everyone stay on top of deadlines and documents, and helps you get paid on time.

The Dynamic Quatro

Stanford brought us to HCI. HCI brought us here.

Founder and CMO

We're a collection of business students and programmers, but what we have in common is a desire to improve group travel planning. Instagator is the result of this desire having an affair with course requirements.

Lo-Fi Prototyping

We drew out a pretend app to see how users would feel about using a tablet to complete a few of our tasks. We learned quite a bit about what felt right and natural and what didn't, without worrying about how things looked.

Documents:

Lo-Fi Write Up


  • Due Date: October 22, 2015
  • Studio Task: Lo-Fi Prototype

Concept Video

After deciding on one prototype to run with, we filmed a video to show the problem we wanted to solve -- group travel. More importantly, we wanted to show how delightful we envisioned life would look after solving group travel.

Documents:

Process and Storyboard
Concept Video

  • Due Date: October 15, 2015
  • Studio Task: Concept Video

How Might We?

This week, we met five more interviewees and focused on three specific dimensions of traveling-- alone and in groups, for work and for pleasure, and pre- versus during travel. We dug deep and posed dozens of questions that hoped to answer how we might improve their experiences. We then narrowed our questions down to a few problems, came up with a few dozen solutions, and tested three of them in the field.

Documents:

HMW, POV, and Protyping Write-up
Presentation

  • Due Date: October 8, 2015
  • Studio Task: HMW/POV

Needfinding

In this initial stage, we met Jonathan, Katie, and Rajan, three travelers with different levels of experience. We began to find traveling pain points and created a huge empathy map.
